original_data.question: A 78-year-old man comes to the physician because of progressively worsening fatigue and headache for 6 months and occasional abdominal pain. He has not had any changes in his weight. He has a history of hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and chronic shoulder pain. Current daily medications include hydrochlorothiazide, metformin, and ibuprofen. He does not drink alcohol and does not smoke. His diet has mostly consisted of potatoes and lean meats since his wife passed away 1 year ago. His pulse is 92/min and blood pressure is 135/80 mm Hg. Examination shows conjunctival and mucosal pallor. Abdominal and rectal examination shows no abnormalities. Neurological exam shows mild postural tremor. Peripheral blood smear shows red blood cells with increased zones of central pallor and anisocytosis. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient’s symptoms?

model_response:
The patient’s symptoms and physical findings are consistent with anemia of chronic disease. The most common cause of anemia of chronic disease is insufficient production of erythropoietin (choice C) by the kidneys. Chronic inflammatory conditions, such as diabetes mellitus, hypertension, and chronic shoulder pain, are the most common causes of anemia of chronic disease. Chronic diseases can also lead to a functional iron deficiency (choice D) by impairing the absorption of iron and increasing iron requirements. Folic acid deficiency (choice A) can cause megaloblastic anemia, but this patient’s peripheral blood smear does not show the characteristic hypersegmented neutrophils of megaloblastic anemia. Intravascular hemolysis (choice B) is not a common cause of anemia.

The treatment of anemia of chronic disease involves correcting the underlying disease, if possible, and ensuring adequate iron stores. Iron supplementation is usually necessary, even if iron studies are normal, because of increased iron requirements.

###Answer: OPTION C IS CORRECT.</s><s>

This results in increased excretion of water and electrolytes, including sodium, potassium, chloride, and magnesium. It is used in the treatment of several disorders including edema, hypertension, diabetes insipidus, and hypoparathyroidism.
